hostname_rule.message: Hostname contains 'security' — review access controls, restrict exposure, and ensure strict authentication on this asset.
Development environment detected — limit public access, disable debug features, and separate it from production systems.
Test or QA environment found — remove external exposure and ensure no production data is present.
Staging environment detected — restrict access to internal users and align security controls with production standards.
Production-labelled hostname — verify proper hardening, logging, and monitoring to reduce risk on critical assets.
Hostname indicates internal systems — ensure these are not reachable externally and enforce network segmentation.
DMZ-labelled hostname — confirm tight firewall rules, limited services, and proper isolation from internal networks.
API-related hostname — verify authentication, rate limiting, and version control to reduce misuse.
Authentication-related system detected — enforce MFA, validate TLS configuration, and restrict public access.
Database-referenced hostname — ensure the database is not public, enforce firewall rules, and require strong authentication.
Cache-layer hostname — restrict network exposure and require authentication to prevent data leakage.
Legacy system detected — schedule an update, apply compensating controls, and review for outdated dependencies.
Backup or mirror system — ensure no sensitive data is publicly accessible and enforce strict access controls.
Static asset hostname — verify correct content-only exposure and ensure no backend files leak through this host.
Mail-related host — enforce encrypted transport (TLS), block unauthenticated relays, and restrict admin interfaces.
VPN endpoint detected — require MFA, limit IP access where possible, and monitor for brute-force attempts.
Administrative system detected — enforce strong authentication, IP restrictions, and minimize public exposure.
Edge or gateway host — review ingress rules, validate TLS settings, and ensure no unnecessary open services.
Cluster-related hostname — ensure Kubernetes control plane is not public and enforce RBAC and network restrictions.
Worker or node host — ensure these instances are internal-only and hardened according to baseline configurations.
Monitoring/operations system detected — restrict public access and require authentication for dashboards and metrics.

defaults.message: No hostname pattern matched — continue with routine checks and validate exposure based on role and function.
